hypothesis_content.title: BTC Dominance Catalyst During Stress Regime Transitions
hypothesis_content.statement: During STRESS → NEUTRAL regime transitions, positive BTC-specific catalysts (ETF flows, halving narrative) amplify BTC dominance moves by +1.5% more than during stable regimes, creating 24-hour alpha vs. altcoins.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Post-stress periods see capital seeking quality/safety. BTC catalysts during these windows trigger amplified 'flight to quality' rotations from alts to BTC as risk appetite remains fragile. Dominance moves exceed typical ranges.
entry_conditions: Regime transition: STRESS → NEUTRAL within past 2 days
BTC-specific catalyst (daily ETF net inflow > $200M, major institutional adoption news)
Altcoin/BTC pairs showing weakness (top 10 alts avg 1h return < -0.5% vs BTC)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC dominance reaches local resistance (previous 7-day high) OR +2.0% move achieved
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC dominance reverses below entry level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: BTC dominance moves post-catalyst are not significantly different from non-catalyst periods during similar regime transitions (t-test p > 0.1)
